oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 20 b.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 20 b. Newspaper clipping: Come to the White House. Sunday, March 4 [1913].
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Women's suffrage;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Come to the White House Sunday, March 4 AT 3 O'CLOCK To Support Great Delegation of Suffragists Led by Miss Anne Martin and Mrs. 0. H. P. Belmont Who will ask that women be enfranchised before action is taken by the government on war or any other question COME IN THOUSANDS Assemble at 2 o'clock at National Headquarters Lafayette Square Congressional Union for Woman Suffrage and National Woman's Party I expect to take part in the deputation to the White House SUNDAY, MARCH 4th, AT THREE O'CLOCK
Name. Address. Telephone ~ Occupation Please meet at 2 o'clock at Congressional Union Headquarters, 21 Madison Place, Lafayette Square, Washington, D. C. Fill in the above form and mail to enrollment chairman, Congressional Union Headquarters.
